name: Crescent Beach Motel

reviews.title: A step back in time
reviews.text: My husband and I loved this place. After a long drive up the Pacific Coast Highway from San Francisco, we were looking for a peaceful, relaxing setting. We checked in and the room, although definitely dated, offered everything we needed for the night and was exceptionally clean. I immediately opened the sliding glass doors that opened up to the beach and ventured out to check out the surf. Within 5 minutes I met some folks who recommended the restaurant next door and invited us to join them later that evening as they were planning to build a fire on the beach. After a very nice meal, we did indeed join them and had a wonderful conversation in a perfectly idyllic setting. There aren't too many places that still allow you to build fires on the beach. We retired to our room and felt perfectly safe leaving the sliding door open so that we could enjoy the sound of the surf.

reviews.title: Great views and location, not so great comfort
reviews.text: Pros: friendly, helpful staff; great location right on the beach; porch facing the beach

reviews.title: Amazing beach front room!
reviews.text: Cons: Small rooms; uncomfortable pillows

reviews.title: Best in Crescent City
reviews.text: Neutral: Restaurant next door is OK but a bit overpriced for what you get (the service is top-notch however)

reviews.title: Beautiful spot on the ocean
reviews.text: We stayed here on our trip through the redwoods. The kids loved this place because the beach is right outside the sliding glass door. The beach is large and flat so the kids had a blast. There really is no breakfast. The room was fairly small and old but very clean. The bed was very firm and I had a hard time sleeping but I'd stay there again for the location! The drains also didn't seem to keep up. 101 is right outside the front door. The view was incredible. I'm going to include some pictures. Also, the Chart room which is on Anchor way (the first left going north) has great food with a wonderful view of the marina and seals and sea lions. We had breakfast and dinner there. Nothing fancy but a fun place.

reviews.title: Great Stay Wonderful View.
reviews.text: We just spent one night at Crescent Beach Motel, I must say it was very nice. I was worried about staying in Crescent City reading the reviews but we thought we would stay one night coming back from Oregon. Check-in was very fast and we were told about coffee and tea all day by the lobby and hot cereal in the morning.

reviews.title: Close to beach & Hwy
reviews.text: Our room was very clean, we had a sliding door that went out to a deck that had chairs to relax and watch the surf. We took a walk on the beach that is only steps away from the Motel. We were able to watch a beautiful sunset too. Our room was good Motel size with a table and two chairs. The carpet was clean and bedding was on the new side. We could hear the surf at night which we just love.

reviews.title: beautiful beach at your door
reviews.text: I do wish the breakfast was more, with it only being hot cereal.

reviews.title: Nice Place to Stay
reviews.text: But I must say it was nice and I'm sure will go back again.

reviews.title: Great motel!
reviews.text: Indeed, a nice and clean motel. One of the few with double-glazed windows, so it's not noisy if your room faces the highway. The 55 mph zone of the Highway. And if you don't open the windows, it's definitely OK. Rooms facing the sea are much quieter I think, view is great. Perfect location if you want to go south. Down south, the selection of accomodation with ocean view is extremely limited for many many miles.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This motel is on the beach, that seems to be the crux of it's popularity. There is so much public beach in Crescent City, that the hotel being on the beach is no big deal. My husband and I spent one night at the Curly Redwood Lodge and one night here. Let me tell you, I whish that we had spent both nights at the Curly Redwood.
reviews.title: So what, it's on the beach?
Cranky,Cranky, Cranky
reviews.text: We stayed in a single queen room with beach access. The room was relatively dark, due in part the dirty light fixtures. As a matter of fact, laying in bed I could look up at the fixture over the bed and see a layer of dead bugs. Yuck! Speaking of the bed, it was hard and uncomfortable. The pillows were made of cheap foam, and we woke up tired and cranky. It would have been nice to sleep with the door cracked so that we could hear the ocean, but there was no screen. The poor light in the bath room made it feel like you were taking a shower in a tiny closet.
If your only requirement for a motel in a beach town is beach access from your room, you might like it here. Otherwise, do yourself a favor and drive on by.

reviews.text: Crescent Beach Motel
reviews.title: Simplicity at it's BEST!
Just a great place to relax, no ups, no extras!
reviews.text: July 2006

reviews.title: I give this Motel is a **Minus Five**
reviews.text: This $103 Motel Room (Rate was raised another $12 upon atrrival) ... is located directly on HWY 101. The Constant traffic noise from the Logging trucks (about 20 yards away) rattled the room all night. The room itself was very cramped, old, with rock hard beds, and an ancient 17" TV. We could clearly hear snoring through the paper thin walls over our portable Sound Machine that we bring just to drown out such noises (No success this time) .The bathroom in this 40-50 year old establishment was miniscule ... about the size of a small broom closet. There was a small Screened window in the bathroom (About shoulder High) that will allow you to Meet and greet your neighbors as they walk by! The only posiitve during the stay was the View ... as long as the kids from the next room weren't playing on the *Communal* deck that runs the length of all of the Ocean facing rooms... meaning that if we left the curtains open, we had kids and adults from other rooms, sitting in front of our sliding glass door, smoking, and looking into our room... Absolutely Unacceptable. Be aware that there are Brand New Hotels on the water a little further North in town. Hampden Inn and Suites and a new Holiday Inn Express currently under construction

reviews.title: SO glad we stayed here!
reviews.text: The Crescent Beach Motel was a welcome stop on a long road trip up 101. The staff is friendly to the point of chatty. The room was sparklingly clean- the bathtub and shower seemed to be brand new. There was no phone or TV or computer hookup in the room, but that was fine with us- we wanted a vacation away from all that stuff! The bed was comfortable, and the room was dark and quiet at night- all we heard was the surf.

reviews.title: Good Experience
reviews.text: We got a beach-facing room with a queen bed. The rooms are about ten steps from a long, walkable beach. All the other folks staying there had chairs outside their rooms and in the evening lots of people sat outside on the long wooden walkway, reading or drinking wine. The restaurant across the parking lot had pretty decent family-style food.

reviews.title: No pretense
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again- the town itself isn't much to write home about, but this motel and their beachfront rooms were a nice, clean, quiet respite.

reviews.title: Crescent Beach Motel Excellent Stay!
reviews.text: We only stayed one night while passing through Crescent CIty but it was a very good experience. The room was right on the beach with the waves crashing in the background making wonderful slumber music. While very much a room one would expect out of the fifties or sixties, it was clean and comfortable. We did not encounter rude owners. In fact both were very friendly and helpful. If you can observe common courtesy and common sense, the Crescent Beach Hotel is a great choice.

description: If you get any closer to the beach than from Crescent Beach Motel rooms, your blankets would get wet! Beachfront lodging is what we offer. In pure comfort, you can go to sleep to the sound of crashing waves (or shut them out if you prefer) and wake to see the beachfront without lifting your head from pillow. Open the sliding glass door and smell the fresh ocean salt air. It's a dream come true - Oceanfront lodging- at a price you can afford! There is nothing to spoil your ocean front view from our rooms. No high rise buildings or fast food signs -- just miles of open beachfront - totally unspoiled. Enjoy walks on the beach, whale watching, kite flying, or just lounging on the deck watching the ocean. When you want something more, just a few miles away there are tide pools and ancient, tall Redwoods in Stout Grove. Experience beachfront lodging at the Crescent Beach Motel - the ONLY motel on the beach!
